docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 4 -- Today's dispatches from Argentina report the complete failure of yesterday's attempted revolution in the province of Entre Rios, saying order has been completely restored.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 4 -- Today's dispatches from Argentina report the complete failure of yesterday's attempted revolution in the province of Entre Rios, saying order has been completely restored.

headline.main: ARGENTINE REVOLT COLLAPSES QUICKLY; Rebels Flee La Paz, the Only Town They Took, on Approach of Loyal Troops. ATTEMPT WAS UNPOPULAR Even Newspapers Unfriendly to Regime Condemn Violence on Eve of a New Administration.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The bond market on the Stock Exchange failed yesterday to make much headway in the first full trading period of the new year. United States Government bonds were weak, and domestic corporation issues averaged substantially lower for the day. Leading...
docs.lead_paragraph: The bond market on the Stock Exchange failed yesterday to make much headway in the first full trading period of the new year. United States Government bonds were weak, and domestic corporation issues averaged substantially lower for the day. Leading foreign loans, however, made some progress, but many of the lower-rated issues of the foreign group lost a point or more in relatively quiet trading.

headline.main: HOME BONDS WEAK ON STOCK EXCHANGE; Many Rails Lose Last Week's Advances -- Federal Issues Off 5-32 to 1 28-32 Points. GAINS IN FOREIGN GROUP German 7s and 5 1/2s, Up 3 1/2 and 1 3/4, Lead Activity -- French Government Loans Off.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 6 -- The diplomatic relations of Uruguay and Argentina are rapidly becoming strained as a result of Sunday's attempted revolt in the Province of Entre Rios, the Argentine Ambassador here having presented a note to Foreign...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 6 -- The diplomatic relations of Uruguay and Argentina are rapidly becoming strained as a result of Sunday's attempted revolt in the Province of Entre Rios, the Argentine Ambassador here having presented a note to Foreign Minister Blanco which the Ambassador told reporters is a formal protest.
docs.abstract: Diplomatic relations of Argentina and Uruguay strained; Argentina files note of protest to Uruguay as result of attempted revolt; rebel leaders in Brazil

headline.main: ARGENTINA WARNS URUGUAY ON PLOTS; Tension Is Strained as Note of Protest Is Filed -- Envoy of Montevideo Goes Home. FOUR MORE SLAIN IN FIGHT Planes Join In Chase of Rebels and Bomb Their Headquarters -- City of La Paz Entrenches.

headline.main: STATE DEPARTMENT BLAMED ON LOANS TO LATIN AMERICA; Bolivian Issue, Now in Default, Approved Despite a Warning by Commerce Bureau. FOR DIPLOMATIC REASONS G.M. Jones Tells Senators of His Protest -- Similar Case in Colombian Issue. GLASS ASSAILS STIMSON Department Is Morally Responsible for American Foreign Investment Losses, He Says. STATE DEPARTMENT BLAMED ON LOANS

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (AP) -- A slight brightening of American foreign trade in November was pictured today by the Commerce Department in figures showing increased purchases by Asia and a break in the rate of general recession. The month's total of...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (AP) -- A slight brightening of American foreign trade in November was pictured today by the Commerce Department in figures showing increased purchases by Asia and a break in the rate of general recession. The month's total of $343,272,212 was a decline of 30 per cent from November in 1930.
docs.abstract: Dept of Commerce rept for Nov

headline.main: PURCHASES BY CHINA DOUBLED FOR MONTH; November Total Makes Large Increase in Foreign Trade, Says Commerce Report. SALES TO JAPAN ALSO RISE Raw Cotton, Wheat, Gas and Fuel Oils Form Bulk of Demands by Asiatic Countries. RUSSIA BUYS LESS HERE Recession in Overseas Business Is Lessened -- United Kingdom Still Our Best Customer.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Jan. 7 -- Sunday's abortive revolt in Argentina has been eclipsed by the diplomatic tension with Uruguay which has grown out of it. Both the Uruguayan and Argentine Foreign Offices are continuing to refuse to make public Argentina's...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Jan. 7 -- Sunday's abortive revolt in Argentina has been eclipsed by the diplomatic tension with Uruguay which has grown out of it. Both the Uruguayan and Argentine Foreign Offices are continuing to refuse to make public Argentina's formal protest to Uruguay.
docs.abstract: Note on revolt said to be curt; denial of blame by Uruguay forecast; effort to smoke out rebels on island of La Redonda; Radical leaders seized

headline.main: FEELING IN URUGUAY ON ARGENTINA RISES; Note on Revolt Is Said to Be Curt and Denial of Blame by Montevideo Is Forecast. INSURGENTS ADMIT DEFEAT Government Planes Rake Last Camp of Rebels With Machine Guns -- Radical Leaders Seized.
